text.p: Netscape Communications and Forte Software Inc said they have reached an agreement to work together to help customers develop high-performance applications that can work with the Internet.
They will enable developers to rapidly build applications using Internet technologies for so-called Intranets and Extranets without writing software code.

Intranets are internal corporate networks based on Internet technology and Extranets are a growing class of applications that can connect companies with suppliers and customers, for example, over the public Internet.

The two companies said they have already begun work on creating seamless access between services offered within Forte's products and an interface to Netscape's recently announced Visual JavaScript, a programming tool developers can use to build applications designed to run across networks.

Netscape has dubbed this family of programs "crossware" and the company said it will be a good mechanism for customers to take advantage of the distributed functionality of Forte applictions, including its object-oriented tools.
Object-oriented software enables developers to use and reuse prewritten software, or objects, in constructing programs to simply and reduce the cost of programming.
Earlier, VASCO Corp VASC.O said it had signed an agreement with Netscape to bundle Netscape's SuiteSpot integrated server software suite with VASCO's suite of Internet security products.
Under the terms of the agreement, VASCO said it and Netscape will jointly market the products through the Netscape Affiliate Plus Value Added Resellers (VARS) worldwide program.
